description: This course explores the lives of gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender people from several
social science perspectives.  Students examine whether gender and sexual orientation (both
heterosexual and homosexual) are socially constructed or biologically natural, and what
cross-cultural and historical examples can tell us.  Students also study controversies over the
family and religious status of GLBT people, why homosexuality has become such a political
issue, and movements for change.  Offered during interim.
